results.title: Ballet mecanique (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The French cubist painter Fernand Leger collaborated with American photographer Dudley Murphy to produce a dynamic view of modern life in the 1920’s. Using a series of rapidly intercut contrasting images, the film reduces humans to mechanical objects, creating rhythms and patterns of expressive force.

Tibet: the roof of the world

results.title: Bahrain: The pearl of the Arabian Gulf
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Passport travellers’ guides”.
Bahrain, an island nation in the Arabian Gulf, was once the capital of the pearl trade and was the site of the first oil discovery in the Gulf States. This includes an interview with the Amir of the State of Bahrain.

results.title: Ballad to Crowfoot
results.creator_credit: Willie Dunn, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An impressionistic, haunting, often bitter account of the opening of the Canadian west, presented through still photography and the words and music of Willie Dunn, a Micmac from Montreal.

results.title: Guam: gateway to Micronesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Passport travellers’ guides”.
Guam lies in the western reaches of the Pacific ocean. With its green rolling hills, soft trade winds, gleaming whilte sands, coral reefs and tranquil lagoons, Guam offers the idyllic escape.

results.title: Ballad to Cornwallis
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Ian McLaren, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Balladeer James Bennet satirises the history of Halifax in a song which he composed and sings in honour of the city’s founder. Clad in period costumes, Bennet travels through time against a background of old photographs and paintings, archival and contemporary film footage, until he ultimately finds himself in the midst of the city’s present-day building boom.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane Beaudry, Ian McLaren, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Balinese surfer 2: wave of change [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bill Leimbach, Richard Flax, ABC-TV (Australia) and Lucky Country Productions
results.brief_description: In 1978, producer/director Bill Leimbach visited the Indonesian island of Bali and filmed a group of young Balinese boys who had discovered the art of surfing. This is the sequel to that film “Balinese surfer” as Bill and his production team revisit the original group, now all aged in their 40s, 25 years later. We follow their individual stories, the direction life has taken them, and how most of them still take time out to surf. Through personal narratives, intercut with footage from the original film, these Balinese men all express their concern for the environment, particularly with the enormous increase in tourism during the 80s and 90s. Their priority issues are with maintaining the supply of fresh water, and preventing sewage run-off into the ocean, reef bombing, and toxic gases from burning plastic. Bali is renowned for having some of the best waves in the world and through a program of surfing contests (attracting the international media), surfing magazines and an organization called Wave of Change, the focus is now on the next generation, who also surf, to be environmental ambassadors and promote the message for preservation of the marine environment and a policy of sustainable development in Bali and throughout the Indonesian islands. Narration - John Sheerin; Director of Photography - Simon Manzie.

results.title: Bag of rice = Kiseye berenj
results.creator_credit: Mohammad-Ali Talebi, Mari Iwata, Uta Miyamoto and Digital Media Lab, Inc
results.brief_description: Nobody seems to have time for four year old Jairan. She is from a large Tehranean family, where her parents have to work and her brothers and sisters are all too busy with their homework. One day she manages to convince her neighbour, Mrs Khanoom, to take her on a shopping expedition for a bag of rice. This proves to be demanding feat when, after making their way through the busy streets of Tehran, they find that the shop has already closed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mohammad-Ali Talebi, Mari Iwata, Uta Miyamoto and Digital Media Lab, Inc

results.title: Bad by design: designers break the rules
results.creator_credit: Damien Ledwich, Jo Forsyth, Terry Murphy, Australian Film Commission, Blurred and Film Queensland
results.brief_description: From the Australian Film Commission’s Micro Docs Series II, Bad by Design explores the designing and creative process of three Australian designers; Max Bannah (Animator), Elisabeth Watson-Brown (Architect) and Mimmo Cozzolino (Graphic Designer). They reveal their goals with their work and how they’ve made their unique vision and approach succeed. All are highly accomplished in their own right and give the viewer a glimpse of their motivations and creative outlook. Illustrative animations by Damien Ledwich based on the Designers are intermixed throughtout.
